commments: Tests covering the steam query smoke cases.

tests.name: top_k w/o count in stream global aggregation
tests.description: create a table test_topmax, 1 column for 1 type and ingest data top_k on int

statements.query: create stream if not exists test_topmax (uuid uuid, int int, uint uint8, string string, float float, decimal decimal32(3), date date, datetime datetime, enum enum('a'=1, 'b'=2, 'z'=26), tuple tuple(s string, i int), ipv4 ipv4, ipv6 ipv6, map map(string, int), nullable nullable(datetime64), timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))

tests.name: top_k on tubple of (int, map) w/ count in stream global aggregation
tests.description: create a table test_topmax, 1 column for 1 type and ingest data top_k on (int, map)

statements.query: create stream if not exists test_topmax (uuid uuid, int int, uint uint8, string string, float float, decimal decimal32(3), date date, datetime datetime, enum enum('a'=1, 'b'=2, 'z'=26), tuple tuple(s string, i int), ipv4 ipv4, ipv6 ipv6, map map(string, int), nullable nullable(datetime64), timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
select array_join(top_k((int, map),3,true)) from test_topmax limit 2

tests.name: top_k in tumble
tests.description: create a table test_topmax, 1 column for 1 type and ingest data top_k on (int,map) on tumble window

statements.query: create stream if not exists test_topmax (uuid uuid, int int, uint uint8, string string, float float, decimal decimal32(3), date date, datetime datetime, enum enum('a'=1, 'b'=2, 'z'=26), tuple tuple(s string, i int), ipv4 ipv4, ipv6 ipv6, map map(string, int), nullable nullable(datetime64), timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
select window_start, window_end, array_join(top_k((int, map),3,true)) from tumble(test_topmax, timestamp, 10s) where (int=-1234561 or int=-1234566)group by window_start, window_end

tests.name: top_k in session
tests.description: create a table test_topmax, 1 column for 1 type and ingest data top_k on (int,map) on session window

statements.query: create stream if not exists test_topmax (uuid uuid, int int, uint uint8, string string, float float, decimal decimal32(3), date date, datetime datetime, enum enum('a'=1, 'b'=2, 'z'=26), tuple tuple(s string, i int), ipv4 ipv4, ipv6 ipv6, map map(string, int), nullable nullable(datetime64), timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
select top_k(ipv4, 2, true) from session(test_topmax, timestamp, 2s) where ipv4=cast('192.168.168.161','ipv4') partition by int

tests.name: top_k w/count and w/o count in table
tests.description: create a table t_fixeds with fixed_string type and ingest, query, but of proton-python-driver

statements.query: select fixeds from t_fixeds settings seek_to = 'earliest'

tests.name: top on datetime
tests.description: create a table t_lowcard with low_cardinality type and ingest, query, but of proton-python-driver

statements.query: select lowcard from t_lowcard settings seek_to = 'earliest'

tests.name: top on json
tests.description: create a table t_lowcard with low_cardinality type and ingest, query, but of proton-python-driver

statements.query: select lowcard from t_lowcard settings seek_to = 'earliest'

tests.name: top on float output in order
tests.description: create a table t_lowcard with low_cardinality type and ingest, query, but of proton-python-driver

statements.query: select lowcard from t_lowcard settings seek_to = 'earliest'

tests.name: max on float output in order
tests.description: create a table test_topmax, 1 column for 1 type and ingest data max_k on float on session window

statements.query: create stream if not exists test_topmax (uuid uuid, int int, uint uint8, string string, float float, decimal decimal32(3), date date, datetime datetime, enum enum('a'=1, 'b'=2, 'z'=26), tuple tuple(s string, i int), ipv4 ipv4, ipv6 ipv6, map map(string, int), nullable nullable(datetime64), timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
select max_k(ipv4, 2), window_start, window_end from session(test_topmax, timestamp, 2s) partition by uuid group by window_start, window_end

tests.name: max on float output in order
tests.description: create a table test_topmax, 1 column for 1 type and ingest data max_k on float on session window

statements.query: create stream if not exists test_topmax (uuid uuid, int int, uint uint8, string string, float float, decimal decimal32(3), date date, datetime datetime, enum enum('a'=1, 'b'=2, 'z'=26), tuple tuple(s string, i int), ipv4 ipv4, ipv6 ipv6, map map(string, int), nullable nullable(datetime64), timestamp datetime64(3) default now64(3))
select uuid, max_k(ipv4,2) from tumble(test_topmax, timestamp, 2s) where uuid = '4c6a2a19-4f9f-456f-b076-c43ef97255d1' group by uuid, window_end
